content:
{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-347-02-B
|Item_parent=Acute urine retention
|Item_parent_short=Acute urine retention
|Rank=B
|Title=Knowing the pathophysiology of acute urinary retention
|Description=None
|Rubric=Physiopathology
|Contributors=Jonathan Olivier
|Order=2}}

*Normal micturition requires:
**a voluntarily opening bladder neck
**an un-narrowed urethra
**a bladder that contracts thanks to the detrusor muscle
**a nervous system that allows simultaneous detrusor contraction and sphincter relaxation.

*Acute retention of urine can therefore be caused by :
**mechanical obstruction
**abnormal detrusor contraction

properties.question: Which of the following is NOT a cause of acute urinary retention?
properties.option_a: Mechanical obstruction in the urinary tract
properties.option_b: Abnormal contraction of the detrusor muscle
properties.option_c: A nervous system that prevents simultaneous detrusor contraction and sphincter relaxation
properties.option_d: A bladder that contracts due to the detrusor muscle
